ygData.subject: What's the deal with DPH
ygData.msgSnippet: Ironically, I seem to be the only one somewhat familiar with Visual Basic. Let my explain my situation. 1)In order to earn money, I have to work 8 hours a day,

Subject: What's the deal with DPH
Message-ID: <9gdm6i+9vg0@...>
In-Reply-To: <00b401c0f476$1faca3e0$9bbf20cb@pentium600>
User-Agent: eGroups-EW/0.82
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Length: 1292
X-Mailer: eGroups Message Poster
From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

Ironically, I seem to be the only one somewhat familiar with Visual 
Basic.

Let my explain my situation.

1)In order to earn money, I have to work 8 hours a day, like most 
people.  Plus I have to do some housework and yardwork.

2)This is not the only place I am visible on the 'net.  I am moderator 
of another yahoo group, admittedly is not very active.  I was doing an 
RP in another area.  I need to catch up on that.  In addition to that, 
 I got into a writing group online - the TGS staff.  They continue off 
where the series 'Gargoyles' left, except ignore almost all of the 
'Gargoyles: the Goliath Chronicles'.

3)Pet Programming project.  Once upon a time, I started to work on a 
program to play 'Othello' or 'Reversi'.  Most of my GUI is written in 
Visual Basic and the intelligence was to be written in C.  
Unfortunately, I discovered for that to work, I need to compile the 
intelligence as a DLL file.  Because of lack of access to such a 
compiler, I have had to put that project on hold.  I do have plans for 
acquring that in a few months (online acquitance will buy it for me at 
a reduced cost and ship it to me and I will repay him.).

With all of the above going on, I feel that if I tried taking any more 
 things, I would be stretching myself a little too thin.
